thread.title: Gold Prices Fall on Stronger Dollar

author: Ira Iosebashvili
title: Gold Prices Fall on Stronger Dollar
text:
Gold prices fell Monday, pushed down by a stronger dollar.
Gold for June delivery was down 0.5% at $1,317.40 a troy ounce on the Comex division of the New York Mercantile Exchange.
The WSJ Dollar Index was up 0.5% at 85.55. A rising dollar tends to pressure commodity prices, which are denominated in the U.S. currency and become more expensive... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
